page.title: 09The Market
page.content: There has been a market in Market Harborough ever since 1204.It used to be held in the middle of the street. The market nowadays is inside a market hall. It is divided into two sections. The first part is fairly small and is mainly fresh food stalls. The second part,the cattle market,has lots of different sorts of animal pens.They sell pigs, sheep and cattle.There are about 100 pigs on sale each week.The number of sheep depends on the season.Some times there are as many as 1500.After the end of June there may be as many as 300 cattle sent to the market. People in villages nearby come to shop, because it gives them a better choice of food and other goods.Today shops in Market Harborough are mainly family businesses but there are some big chain stores e.g. Tesco,& the Co-op.
